intro: Nanorrhinum stenanthum, commonly known as the narrow-nosed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Nanorrhinum stenanthum is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
